intro: Strombosia zenkeri, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Strombosia zenkeri is adapted to thrive in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Its nocturnal flowering habit makes it an important species for night pollinators such as moths.
